Description: Fragment of large banded painted pottery stamnos with part of handle; clay is fired a pinkish-brown; cream slip; dark-brown paint.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, Findspot 51, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: Findspot 51 is detemined by Petrie 1888, p.60, pl. xxiv, 10.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 58, p. 62 § 59, pl. xxiv, 10)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 58, IX.1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 281)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.213)
